intro: Blepharis hirtella, commonly known as the hairy blepharis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and hairy leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue to lavender in color. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Blepharis hirtella is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
